alert.note: Alert for Riverside; San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 3:00PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 457 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Riverside and San Diego. * WHEN...Until 457 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 300 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen over the mountains and desert slopes. - Vallecito Wash is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hwy 78 Between Banner and S2, Julian, Hwy 78 Between S2 and Borrego Springs Rd, Borrego Springs, Ranchita, Borrego Palm Canyon, Hwy S22 Between Ranchita and Borrego Springs, Hwy S2 Between Hwy 79 and Hwy 78, Warner Springs and Hwy 79 Between Santa Ysabel and Warner Springs. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When Flooded turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
